think_procedure: To determine if the 'enable_partitionwise_aggregate' knob in PostgreSQL is a special knob, we first need to understand its role and the values it can take. This knob enables or disables the feature of partition-wise aggregation in PostgreSQL. The values it can take are Boolean: either 'true' or 'false'. A value of 'true' enables the feature, allowing the system to perform aggregation on a per-partition basis, which can improve performance in partitioned tables. A value of 'false' disables this feature. Since the knob takes only Boolean values and each directly controls the feature's state without any non-ordinal or exceptional behavior outside of the typical Boolean control, it does not fit the definition of a 'special knob' with non-sequential special values like -1 or 0 that alter its behavior in an unconventional way.
